remarks: This lemma is used to prove that there exists a function x as in the proof of Lemma 2 in [BrosowskiDeutsh] p. 91: assuming that ` r ` is a finite subset of ` W ` , ` x ` indexes a finite set of functions in the subalgebra (of the Stone Weierstrass theorem), such that for all i ranging in the finite indexing set, 0 ≤ x_i ≤ 1, x_i < ε / m on V(t_i), and x_i > 1 - ε / m on ` B ` .  Here ` D ` is used to represent A in the paper's Lemma 2 (because ` A ` is used for the subalgebra), ` M ` is used to represent m in the paper, ` E ` is used to represent ε, and v_i is used to represent V(t_i). ` W ` is just a local definition, used to shorten statements.  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 20-Apr-2017.)
